page.title: 15Homes: New and Old
page.content: Architecture in the area varies from older,{terraced}properties having two bedrooms and an{outside W.C.,}to today's styles, mainly{semi-detached. The latter almost always have garages and in the main consist of 3 bedrooms, lounge, dining area and kitchen. All are made from brick with tiled roofs. The two types of property are to be found side by side in many roads, such as{Granby Road}where the old gives way to the new within a few metres. Many of the new windows are{double glazed picture windows giving good views rather than appearing attractive. Most homes have{central heating though a lot of the older properties still have{coal fires. Most modern houses have a garden, front and rear, whereas the terraced often have only a yard or small lawn at the rear and no garden at the front
